intro: Seseli giganteum, commonly known as giant seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems that can reach heights of up to 3 meters. The plant produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a feathery appearance, and it thrives in dry, rocky soils. Seseli giganteum is native to regions of southern Europe and the Mediterranean, where it often grows in open habitats.
